title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
AT&T and Discovery reached a deal to combine their media assets into a new, publicly traded company, unwinding the telecom company's big bet on entertainment after less than three years.

---

Credit Suisse is facing an exodus of senior investment bankers in the wake of a $5.5 billion loss tied to the Archegos meltdown.

---

Activist investor Elliott is urging Duke Energy to consider separating into three companies, in what would be a major transformation of the utility.

---

China's economic activity grew at a slower pace in April as retail sales missed expectations, complicating the picture of a steady and balanced recovery there.

---

Japan's economy shrank in the first quarter as private spending fell amid a resurgence of Covid-19 infections, but it is expected to return to growth.

---

The EU agreed to postpone plans to raise tariffs on some American goods as it begins talks with the Biden administration aimed at lifting U.S. steel tariffs.

---

U.S. stocks fell, with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq retreating 0.2%, 0.3% and 0.4%, respectively.

---

Apple will put CEO Cook on the stand in its courtroom defense against Epic Games' antitrust claims.

---

Amazon is establishing a program focused on improving the health and wellness of its hourly warehouse staffers.
